website_summaries.verdict: While it's a modern machine with dual capabilities to brew traditionally or one cup at a time, it's large and impractical for coffee drinkers who prefer one method or the other.
pros: A unique concept offering traditional 12-cup and single-cup brewing all in one
Has coffee strength selector and is compatible with a variety of pods and K-Cups
cons: The 2-in-1 design comes with one of the highest price tags
Other concerns include occasional reservoir leaks and coffee spattering from the single brew side

customer_reviews.title: Absolute great buy...!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I read all of the reviews before I bought this, and a number of them weren't good... I really wanted the coffeemaker and have been happy with cuisinarts before, so I went for it... I have to say that after reading and following the instructions and trying every option for brewing it offers, this is the best and most versatile coffeemaker I have ever owned in my life... it does it all,... does it perfectly,... and makes great coffee and works perfectly... definitively worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: SPEnser

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I've had many coffee makers over the years and this is by far the best. Most of the makers I have had were Cuisinart brands, but 2 were Keurig (one was the newest model) I love this machine and have not found any issues in the few weeks I've had it. I generally make a pot of coffee in the morning and use the single serve in the afternoon or evening. I have used several types of coffees and each one tastes great. It is easy to use and clean. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CAG

customer_reviews.title: Dont let a few bad reviews keep you from having the best of both worlds!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly on both sides. For those that gave the pictures of blown up kcups etc its because they DIDNT READ THE INSTRUCTIONS! its not the exact same as a keurig brand kcup dispenser. You press and click the kcup down in the bottom before closing the lid and you will never have that issue. The brewing mesh works perfect and saves you from buying filters as well as the kcup side for single serve loose coffe. Just clean the mesh filter and you're good to go! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Z. Collins

customer_reviews.title: I've loved my Cuisinart products over the years
customer_reviews.text: The first one came with a cracked carafe. Amazon sent a replacement, no charge. Received the new carafe and filled the reservoir for the first time cleaning... water all over my kitchen counter. Returned the unit and received replacement. Filled the reservoir for the cleaning... again, water all over my counter. This time it leaked from the single cup reservoir. What gives Cuisinart? Who's doing your quality control? Oh how the mighty have fallen. I've loved my Cuisinart products over the years, but I think I'm done. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Barber

customer_reviews.title: Not the Quality You Expect from Cuisinart - VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Cuisinart fan and I've used their single cup makers for over 7 years. I thought, "this is perfect - the best of both worlds!" I was very wrong and very disappointed. The cover for the large pot side buckled when hot, the carafe came with a cheap plastic lid that I wouldn't expect from them and the single serve side spit water every where. I would expect all of this if we were talking a no-name brand from a dollar store, but this is Cuisinart and it isn't an inexpensive item.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia DeCaro

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or time.  Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Total Garbage. Bought this unit as a gift. Worked for 4 days then the single serve side died. Called Cuisinart and they said they would send a new one out and I would send the original back. After another 6 calls and over 3 hours on hold to check shipping status I received the new unit. Almost 30 days after I made the claim. First day of use, single serve side doesn't work. Push 8 ounce serving, get 2-3 ounces. Try to use the insert for your own ground coffee, won't close enough to activate. Total junk. I am getting rid of this item and changing brands.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Bychowski

customer_reviews.title: ... used to be a queasy night lover I absolutely hate this machine the clock doesn't work right a keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a cuisinart lover I absolutely hate this machine the clock doesn't work right it keeps gaining time the reservoir from the single serve leaks replaced it twice I just can't get any satisfaction and I'm extremely disappointed I will never buy another coffee pot from cuisinart sorry I had a machine old school from cuisinart that worked for 11 years and I wanted to switch over to the combination and this has just been a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Esther P

customer_reviews.title: Fixing the leaky reservoir
customer_reviews.text: I received my coffee maker and just like the many other reviews, the reservoir on my single side leaked from the start...I found some rubber washers in my tool box and put one on the bottom where the water flows thru when the coffee starts...no leak...I agree that the company should fix this themselves, but to those that have the problem, which I believe is many, just get a rubber washer or o-ring that fits the little glass tube at the bottom where it connects to the water flow...Otherwise, so far I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: JERRY  MCBRYDE

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was a great idea. First of all
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great idea. First of all, it worked very very slow! Then it started to explode the pods! Now it does not work at all - just the side where the large pot is. I am very disappointed. And I just bought a box of 120 pods I can no longer use. Very unhappy!!!! Called the company and they sent 2 replacement coffee pots by error - I returned one and kept one. Well - this second one has worked about a week or two and now leaks all over my counter. I am not going for a third time. I want my money back. The idea is great but it hasn't been perfected yet. AWFUL!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. West

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love this Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this at work for small office for the last 2-3 months and had no problems. We enjoy brewing pots in the morning (choice of three burner warming temperatures has been handy) and brewing single cups in the afternoon. Have had absolutely no problems using a variety of K-cups. I actually bought a Keurig 575 first but a decided to return before I used it in favor of this model - and I am glad I did. Looks great, simple to use right out of the box. Keeps water hot during the day and brews coffee quickly - no screwing around! If you have enjoyed your other Cuisinart Coffee makers, you will love this one too.
customer_reviews.author: Rob in AR

customer_reviews.title: $200 for two weeks of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple weeks then the brew timer would not go on. I unplugged the unit, checked the outlet with other items. They worked. Then , plugged it back in NOW nothing works. Dead. No clock etc.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Single Serve Side does not work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: As a previous owner of both the Cuisinart Brew Centra and Cuisinart Single Serve Brewing System, I was excited to try this combination brewer and save space on our countertop. This product was a huge let down. The 12 cup coffee side worked fine; the single serve side did not work well at all. The single serve side was also created a lot of noise ( more than the stand alone Cuisinart Single Serve Brewing System). This product was returned and replaced with a Breville coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Oh My Stars

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should stop selling this junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: The kcups explode leaving a huge mess!! The coffee does not stay warm and the clock runs fast gaining 2 minutes a day. After calling customer service numerous times, and only 3 months old, and a three year warranty, Cuisinart wants me to pay shipping both ways to replace the hunk of junk!!! I told them I would make it a lesson learned and throw it away and go back to our Keurig and Mr coffee. I am in the market for a new microwave and I will not be buying a Cuisinart product again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Ponikvar

customer_reviews.title: Spurts all over the counter and coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to love my new Cuisinart Coffee Center that I purchased just 3 months ago but no matter how much I clean the K-cup side it spurts water/coffee all over the counter and the coffee maker. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L. Backous

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well with K Cups. See Photo. This happened 3 times. Returning today.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design
customer_reviews.text: I liked the functionality of this coffee maker but it needs some major improvements. One, you better make sure that you press the k cup down firm or it will not pierce the cup when you close the lid. Two, filling the 12 cup side is a pain, the lid gets in the way of the pot when filling. Third, the clean light comes on and wont go off despite cleaning it per the instructions. I returned the first one due to this light and it just happened with the replacement...I guess a piece of tape will fix the annoying red light. With the Cuusinart name behind this it should not be this flawed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Fan

customer_reviews.title: very dissappointing!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed in this machine. Tried to love it -- was so excited to get it. Coffee splattered all over the counter every single time. it was unbelievably messy. only one of its kind (dual brew) out there so we were psyched to fine it. Returned it fast. ; (
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart should be better than this
customer_reviews.text: Had it one month and the single brew side quit working. Tried calling Cuisinart and got put on hold for 30 minutes. Then told they would send a label with no solution for what I was to make coffee with. Then they hung up. Tried Amazon and they would willing send out a new one right away although theirs doesn't ship for 1-2 months. Oops. Cuisinart should be better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Dvorscak

customer_reviews.title: Fancy shmancy!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this coffee maker! I was hesitant to purchase after I read some of the reviews stating it splatters, makes a mess, etc. I'm glad I tried it out afterall. It does not splatter at all! I have tried using it with regular sized coffee mugs and taller yeti cups. No mess! I waited 2 months to write this review just in case something went wrong. I cannot think of anything negative to write about this coffee maker! Love the color, love how easy it is to use!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B.

customer_reviews.title: The k-cup section splashes the water out of the cup
customer_reviews.text: The K-Cup section splatters the water. If you brew coffee or tea, make sure you have a tall cup otherwise the liquid will be all over your counter.
customer_reviews.author: jose lopez

customer_reviews.title: We bought this Nov 2016 based on good reviews after going through 2 top of the line ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Nov 2016 based on good reviews after going through 2 top of the line Keurig machines. We change the filters regularly and clean routinely with distilled vinegar and PRESTO 11 months after purchase it has stopped working. I have come to believe the K-cup single cup brewing technology is just not a feasible engineering undertaking. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Moderately Handy

customer_reviews.title: I really like this coffee maker but —-
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Cuisinart coffee maker that started leaking. The coffee is extremely hot and the coffee isn’t as flavorful as my old one. I’m not sure if it’s because of the funnel shaped filter vs the flat bottomed filter they used to have. The water fill area is hard to pour water into without spilling. I bought a funnel shaped measuring cup to fill it with. I still like the Cuisinart coffee makers (this is my 4th one) but the quality has really declined. I’m not sure if I will stick with this brand in the future
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I THOUGHT I KNEW BETTER... Cuisinart is the BEST of the Best - Right?
customer_reviews.text: NOT! I should have listened to the previous reviewers, but of course I thought I knew better... Cuisinart's the best on the market... not so much. Woke up one morning and my entire wooden counter top was flooded; why, who knows! Went to use the 'pod' side a couple of days later, (after using it just the day before,) and it was a clogged up... ruined the k-cup, and again water everywhere. Of course this is some kind of bad karma... I should have paid attention to the reviews I read when I bought this damn machine. Too late to return, so going in the trash. DON'T MAKE MY MISTAKE! This thing is nothing more than good looking crap.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Dog

customer_reviews.title: Should have gone Cuisinart in the first place.
customer_reviews.text: Wife bought me a Keurig for my Birthday, It lasted almost 3 months, I had loaded up on K-cups, on sale at the Navy NEX, When I did my research, the new Keurig 2 will NOT use the Old K-Cups, or un-approved Brands (Perhaps they hired someone from HP) I looked and Looked and found this, Best of both worlds, Brews a pot, and the K-Cups, Reparable Brand name, does NOT lock you into specific K-Cups. As far as Noise, It sounds almost silent compared to the grinding noise I was getting from the Keurig. The tea tastes stronger than it did in the Keurig too; I haven’t tried the coffee yet.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Single Serve just spits the water out, failed from first cup.  :(
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, very disappointed. This coffee make failed from the first cup. The single serve just spit the water out and splashed all over the counter. What a mess. I thought Cuisinart was a better product. I was wrong. I ordered as grinder with the coffee maker as well. Now I'm a little worried. I do not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mavgw

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made with metallic taste
customer_reviews.text: We've loved our previous Cuisinart coffeemakers. This one, however, is very disappointing and we are returning it. The reservoir cover wasn't attached well and would not close correctly. (Doesn't any company use quality materials anymore?) The coffeemaker brewed an OK pot; however, the single-serve brewer left a metallic taste in the coffee - even after several brews. An unacceptable product from the usually reliable Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday! I’ve had it for a few months and the only time I had any problems was when I put the inner kcup holder in backwards, then it made a mess! But I learned my lesson, put it in correctly and it’s worked perfectly since! and once you put it in there really isn’t much of a reason to move it. I love that I have the option to make a pot of coffee or a mug!! I also love that my 2nd grader is now able to get her own hot water for making hot chocolate!
customer_reviews.author: Alison's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Believe the Splattering and Leaking Reviews
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst coffee pot/single pod coffee maker I have ever purchased. The pot side works good enough, nothing special there. It is the single serve side that is total crap. Unless you use a very tall cup or set the cup on something to make it sit higher, it will splatter all over. It also has a tendency to not flow all the water through the single serve pod. It will, I guess, overflow the pod and then the water spreads all over the bottom and leaks all around the cup with about two thirds in the stream that actually make it to the cup. Last Cusinart anything I purchase.
customer_reviews.author: biffsteele

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker, but price fluctuate s a lot!
customer_reviews.text: Love that it has the single serve that doesn't require k-cups! The tiny basket is a bit of a pain to clean, but the coffee is awesome w zero waste! (I compost) I've had the pot version of this coffee maker for years, bought a Keurig and hated how much space the two took up on the counter. I also like that I don't think there's much of an internal reservoir for the single serve so the water doesn't sit inside and get gross. No problems with leaking like other reviews mention, but I don't remove the reservoir, just keep a jar handy to fill it...
customer_reviews.author: JMel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT!! I purchased this in January for our small office area. We have had nothing but trouble with it since we plugged the thing in!! We had a Keurig but needed something that could also make a pot. We should have kept the Keurig. The K cup side has been an absolute mess. Cuisinart will not refund your money, only offer to repair or replace if they see fit and YOU have to pay for the shipping to and from. Never again. I was a long time fan of Cuisinart products but will never purchase from them again. We are off to buy another Keurig. What a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: BLS

customer_reviews.title: Great idea! Faulty part!
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of having a coffee pot and k-cup option in one machine. Unfortunately the k-cup side would malfunction and overflow. Must be something to do with the bottom needle not making a large enough hole or becoming clogged too easily. Either way, it made quite the mess on multiple occasions. I have read on Consumer Reports where I am not the only one that had this issue. Hopefully they can get the issue resolved... The coffee it did produce was great!
customer_reviews.author: Shane M Abrell

customer_reviews.title: Looks, dependable, ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee center, I would change how you fill the reservoir it’s towards the back and it’s actually hard to get the water in it at times without spilling. Never had a problem with answering the pods if I want to single cup coffee. The timer setting was a little difficult for me to understand , I blame that on human error. I have many coffee pods throughout the years and always come back to Cuisinart .I would recommend is coffee center I have the one with the metal pot I love the instructions and you’ll have no problem I love this coffee center and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Defective Clock
customer_reviews.text: 2nd Review: First Cusinart SS-15 was returned after a few weeks due to a defective clock that ran fast, i.e., gained a minute per day. Replacement Unit similarly ran fast about 0.75 minutes per day. Photo shows the time on my iPhone (10:34 AM) against SS-15 which indicated (10:37 AM) after 4 Days. Note the Coffee Maker was set against the iPhone. Other appliances connected to the same outlet show the correct time after 4 days. Spoke to Cusinart Customer Service, they said this is the first time they heard of the problem but was willing to replace the unit at no cost less shipping. Both units brewed excellent tasting Coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Coffee sprays out and grinds make mess! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love this machine. The set up with the k cup on one side and carafe on the other is so ideal but sadly the single serve side does not work well at all! The coffee does not stream out nicely into the cup. Instead it makes a mess spraying the machine, getting on the counter top , etc. horrible. Thought our first was defective so called amazon and they sent a replacement. Nope. This one is the same. Will be returning!!! The grinds on the top make a mess as well. Poor design!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: I love how convenient it is to brew a pot or a single cup with one appliance! We had two different coffee makers on the counter taking up space and now do the same thing with one appliance! It is quick and quiet as well as looks great! It looks and functions as an “upscale” coffee maker without paying an exorbitant amount of menu.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly M.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your $
customer_reviews.text: Had this for nearly 4 months and it leaks water everywhere. This is not worth the $. If I could give less than one star I would. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: jmm

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Cuisinart! I’ve had it for almost two months. It’s smart looking, easy to use, and fast! I love that I can make single serve using my favorite ground coffee and it tastes fresh brewed, not like the “other brand” that tastes like stomach acid. The flavor is perfect, whether it’s single serve or whole pot brew. My only complaint is that the largest single serve setting is 10 oz and I always want more! Buy this one, you won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed in this product from Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: I am really really disappointed in Cuisinart. I love their products but this one just keeps giving me problems. I am only giving two starts because the 12 cup side has been working so far. It is the kcup side that is constantly having problems. It will blow out the coffee kcup when it does work or it will just not work at all! I am glad I bought this through Amazon and they have been very helpful about sending another one. I'm hoping the new one will work better. Otherwise I am asking for my money back and getting a different product. I hope this helps you with your decision on picking a new coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You're going to need one more thing
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a champ! One thing you have to know about the K-cup side. It's made so you can put in tall cups and travel mugs which is really convenient but.... the downside is, if you put a regular mug or cup in there, the distance makes it splash out all around the unit on the counter and the carafe as it's making it. Do yourself a favor and get a 2" x 2"x 4" block to sit under the cup to reduce the drop/splash. Otherwise everything else about this is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: RDUBYA

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the poor reviews because I had a great experience with a previous K-Cup device. However, mine also blew grounds in the coffee and all over the device. But the dagger was a slow internal leak that damaged the hardwoods in the kitchen. This is a great concept, but poorly designed and QA'd.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff M

customer_reviews.title: It's messy
customer_reviews.text: This thing works well but it's a mess. Every keurig I've used might make a few drops or two worth of mess but this thing will have you wiping the counter all the time. I thought it was a great idea bec it has the pot feature, but we haven't used it once. So save yourself the space and just get the stand alone single serve machine. It comes with all the cups for making tea. I recommend running a tank worth of vinegar through it about once a month to keep it running smoothly and lessen the mess factor.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water all over counter
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look and functions of this coffee maker. I wanted to have the 2 options of a carafe and kcup. Unfortunately from day 1 - this leaked water all over my counter. I thought I had put the kcup water reserve in wrong - so I re-did those steps. No fail - still leaks. Sadly returning -- as from reading other reviews the company does not have a fix for this - and I don't want to get a replacement with the same problem and return again. Unfortunate - as I would have loved it if not for water leaking all over my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Passaro

customer_reviews.title: Great machine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my wife makes crack coffee that tweeks me out all day. So now she has her pot and I can make a normal cup of coffee. So far it’s been a great coffee pot. Haven’t had any leaks or over flowing like some other reviews I read on here. There is a certain way the pod basket thing has to go into the single cup side. Read the directions as follow the arrows and it will work. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is great makes delicious coffee. Love the filtered coffee every morning. The only gripe I have is with the clock circuit it doesn't work right, ours runs fast it is now up to 2 hours fast. I have no clue why so we just adjust the auto brew to what time we want compared to the wrong time to brew so we have coffee in the morning, and set it to four hour warming. Other than that it coffee maker is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy OBryan

customer_reviews.title: Works well most of the time
customer_reviews.text: I like the build of this coffee maker. Sturdy and attractive, but the single cup part through grounds inside your coffee sometimes. I can't really know why and when it's going to do it, but its' happened to me 3 times and I've only had it for maybe 2 -3 months. It's frustrating cause it makes it so hard to clean up and usually I'm walking out the door. Just frustrating. I had a Keurig last time and I wanted to get away from them due to the scare of how they are not very clean. Not totally disappointed but somewhat frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't like reservoir for regular coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: This is being returned. Very disappointed in my Cuisinart. It came with a bad K-cup side; I went through several pods before realizing that it wasn't punching holes in the pod in order for the water to run through so I kept getting mugs of hot water. This machine is a bit taller than most which would not be a problem in filling the reservoir for regular coffee pot if I wasn't fairly short. To top it all off, the water reservoir for the regular pot is poorly situated. When you get toward the bottom of the pot of water, you have to shift it around and usually still cannot get all the water into the reservoir. Very, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MoonlitSky

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee/Great Look
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker functions as advertised. Makes a great cup of coffee. The single cup feature with option to use grounds or pods is very useful. Can’t understand why some reviews give fewer stars for the single cup feature. Yes, if you use a shorter cup you will get some splashes as the stream of coffee comes out. Not difficult to see that using a taller cup resolves this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dandrea B.

customer_reviews.title: Major leak straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I had seen some of the negative reviews but decided to buy because of reputation, past experience with Cuisinart, and positive reviews. Filled with water to clean the new machine and 2 of the 12 cups of water were on the counter from the main reservoir. Tried again after cleaning up thinking maybe I spilled some water the first time. Second time I was very careful filling the main reservoir. In 3 minutes it leaked 2 cups of water on the counter without even turning on the brew cycle. It's painfully clear that Cuisinart has some design flaws on this model. Returned to Amazon and purchased a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on pods
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine explodes the pods and makes a mess! As first it happened on off brand pods, but now it explodes most of the pods :( It happened to a few intermittently, so I thought no big deal, but now it does it all the time and of course its beyond the return time. To be fair, the coffee pot side works great. The coffee is hot and stays hot on the warmer. I love that!
customer_reviews.author: ABranson

customer_reviews.title: "Sir Leaksalot"
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it to replace my old cuisinart k-cup machine (which we are still using). I read many reviews and their were quite a few that complained about the machine leaking. I bought it anyway in spite of some bad reviews because of the many features and the ability to brew a pot. Well, low and behold it leaked the very first time we used it and everytime there after. The leak came from inside the unit in the back (under the reservoir ?) I sent it back for a refund. It still brewed tasty coffee , and the k-cup portion also worked well. Couldn't deal with the puddles on the counter top.
customer_reviews.author: RJ/Btown

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for old Cuisinart Coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes to use K-cups, and I make various teas. This Center is the best of both worlds for us. The coffeemaker works the same as my old machine. The single serve works well except the spluttering, especially when it first starts dripping and then again when it finishes. If Cuisinart could improve that problem, I would give them a 5-start rating. After 5 weeks of use, I took the Coffee maker to the dumpster. It kept exploding and coffee going all over the inside of drip cavity, even into the water discharge tube from water heater. After three times in one week, I had had enough. I ordered a Keurig, and it's doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: ncg

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine looks exactly like the picture. I’ve made my coffee from home using a percolator most of my adulthood. I purchased this machine because my husband was tired of inconsistency in his “to go” coffee he purchased every morning. This had what we needed. It has a nice clock, warmer, programmable, easy to use, easy to clean, and single serve side if you need it. My only gripe is that I wish the opening to the water reservoir was bigger-for the pot side. I am always spilling water trying to fill it, I generally use the pot once it’s cleaned. Otherwise, the coffee is brewed nicely and I’m not getting any grounds on it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amos Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this coffee machine. It saves space by eliminating the need for 2 different machines. I definitely recommend watching the video because without it I would not have realized there is an on/off switch. The controls are very unique and take awhile to get used to. The single serve has worked great with any brand of coffee pod I have tried. After a month of use I am very pleased with it. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cdan

customer_reviews.title: 2 in one, great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: The SS-15 By Cuisinart is as advertised. Coupled with the automatic grinder that we also purchased, they make a complete coffee center. My wife likes the single K-Cup brewer and I like the drip brewer. Each side of it has its own merits. I read the negative reviews and it seems to me that most of them could come from the lack of cleaning or a lack of operating per the directions. Anyway, it is new and time will tell. However, our last Cuisinart grind and brew is still working after 5 years and we are giving it to a family member. You will like this coffee maker, I do too.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Pods Explode While Brewing
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this coffee maker. I've tried really hard to like it. But ~6700 feet above sea level, (not even the mountains), the pods explode. I've tried multiple brands. We "pop" the pod with a straight pin prior to brewing. We check each time to ensure that the pod foil is glued tight. Nothing works. Keurig Coffee makers, however, do not explode. I don't know why there is a difference, but I am very tired of cleaning the grounds and mess every third time I brew. 'Nuf said. I'm off to buy another Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Not required

customer_reviews.title: Kcups will not work on the single serving side!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried for 2 days to get a single cup of coffee to come out. When you begin the brew cycle only a slight stream comes out and then there is almost an explosion of coffee grounds and water coming out as the top of the K cup splits apart. It goes all over the counter and floor and my cup has at least 1/4 inch of grounds in the bottom. I have used a full box of 12 cups and I'm not using it again. The mess is too much to keep cleaning up! The 12 cup coffee make does work fine. But for $200 I expected a product that could be counted on.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley George

customer_reviews.title: Mistake would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The 1st time I use the coffee maker the pot side worked great,how ever the single cup side splattered.so I change the kcup tried the extra one and had the same problem.I paid a lot of money for this coffee maker.I know I can"t return it ,I let the window pass.I just don"t want anyone else to make the mistake I made.
customer_reviews.author: DARRYL PRICE SR

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this Coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this Coffee maker. My husband does not drink coffee so I frequently want just 1 cup but when we have guests I need to have the 12 cup pot. it is perfect for either. The pot was easy to learn to use and the coffee tastes great. I especially like the temperature control as my previous
customer_reviews.author: mtnmom

customer_reviews.title: A great combination of carafe and single cup coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my Cuisinart 12-cup (still works) and my Keurig 2.0 K-cup. The carafe section performs the same as my older one with easy settings and a "bold" setting for a stronger brew. The single pod maker needs no preheating and is always clean afterward, but it splashes a lot when brewing a single cup (just place a paper towel around the cup or use a tall cup). Separate water reservoirs for both sides. The carafe side is somewhat difficult to fill, but the single cup side removes nicely. The single-cup maker does not have a "strong" feature as Keurig does.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Original leaks and the replacement one leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Just as other reviewers have said. The single serving side leaks. My wife had a competitors single serving but was doing more traditional brewing. I purchased this 2-in-1 device for xmas for her. After a month the single serving side started leaking all over the counter. So I went through the hassle of a return and got a brand new one. Unfortunately now the new one leaks on the same side. It now sits on a tray on the counter to collect the leaking water. Worst xmas present I ever gave.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mac

customer_reviews.title: I've had it maybe 3 weeks and it leaks so ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had it maybe 3 weeks and it leaks so badly I have to put a bunch of paper towels around it to keep it from soaking my counter top,I'm assuming it's leaking from the reservoir which holds the water for the next cup of coffee,I threw the box away after the first week so now I have no idea what to do!
customer_reviews.author: diane mcginnes

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Did not like anything about it. Did not work properly from day one. Spoke to someone from Amazon on chat about it. Requested return label to return product. I was told I would receive a replacement. Well, I did get a replacement, but it was a used replacement that someone else apparently had returned, and it was just sent to me in the same box, complete with personal notes from someone's family member wishing their grandpa a happy birthday. Needless to say, I immediately return the so-called replacement unit as well. Save your money. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Dalessandro

customer_reviews.title: Love it, with one tiny flaw
customer_reviews.text: We do love this machine. It takes up very little space and has great features such as the auto on and the bold brew for extra strength. The only complaint we have is that there is no ventilation for the carafe brew. All that condensation pours out the back of the lid when you open it. The tiny slot and shelf designed to catch that water and route back into the machine, does not do its job. We just place a towel there when opening, and it’s fine. Just wish it wasn’t necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs D

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. K-Cup side sputtered from day one and we are constantly cleaning up coffee splatters on the counter. After a year the “Clean” indicator light has turned on and we cannot get it to turn off no matter what we do or clean. We had a basic Keurig that lasted four years and are very disappointed in this Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 a cup of coffee?
customer_reviews.text: almost a Great coffee maker. he issue is on the K-Cup side- It dispenses far less coffee per cycle than you would expect the travel mug size dispenses a mere 5 oz, the regular cup size dispense3s 1/3 a cup and the small cup less than that. The problem can be overcome by repeatedly pushing the small serving size until your cup is filled. It would be great if there was some way to calibrate the dispenser. While the workaround is marginally satisfactory it would be even better if it just met my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Craig Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker apparently has a design flaw in the single-cup brewing feature. When using a K-cup, it does not make a clean puncture into the top of the K-cup. Instead it makes a hole that is approximately 3/4" in diameter. Consequently, the coffee grounds go out all over the place (into the cup of coffee and into the top of the brewer as well). Each brewing makes a mess. I will purchase another Keurig for single cup brewing. I'm sorry to have to say this. The coffee maker looks great in my kitchen, and the the 12-cup brewing feature works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul in Asheville, NC

customer_reviews.title: K-Cup Side Ceased Working in 2 Months; Now an overpriced, over-sized, glorified "Mr. Coffee."
customer_reviews.text: The single serve k-cup side just stopped working. Household use only, three or four times a day for 2 months, and it just no longer works. I cleaned it according to instructions. I unplugged it and plugged it back in. It most frequently just makes noise but not coffee, with the control lights flashing. Other times, it spits out steam, and a trickle of coffee (literally, a sip.) Expected much more quality and dependability from the Cuisinart brand. The carafe side works, but makes a horrible mess because of the pressure that the water is dispensed into the basket. Grounds everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Leaking single serve reservoir.
customer_reviews.text: So we just set it up today and found that the single cup reservoir leaks out of the bottom. This isn't a good sign at all, I called Cuisinart support and the first thing out of their mouth was are you going to return it. I asked them first if we can try replacing the reservoir but if that doesn't work I'll be returning it. The initial cleaning went well for the carafe and it is the same dimensions as our version 2.0 Kurig. So we are excited to try it out but if the reservoir leaking all over can't be fixed it will have to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: R. Giesige

customer_reviews.title: Faith restored in Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: 11-8-17 - revising my initial report to say that I love this coffee maker and the combination pot is ideal for our family! Amazon replaced the first malfunctioning pot easily and quickly. My faith has been restored in Cuisinart. Original entry: Former happy owner of DCC-1100 Cuisinart Coffeemaker which lasted 6 years with daily use. Loved it's reliability! Have used SS-15 for one week and it is leaking water from the bottom, plus Clean light is showing already (which seems way too early). Amazon makes the exchange easy, but I'm daunted by the inconvenience and loss of faith in Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: katie_bro

customer_reviews.title: Cheap design and uncalibrated K-Cup dispenser
customer_reviews.text: The lid on the carafe just snaps on(won't last long), K-Cup dispenser spews water out unless you have a cup that reaches all the way up. the unit has 3 buttons for the K-Cup, 6,8,10 oz, however they all dispense 2 more ounces that stated, i.e. you get 8,10,12 ounces respectfully rom each button. This is the third one we tried and they are all the same, one was even worst. Great idea to combine carafe with K-cup, just bad implementation. Don't purchase. Customer service said just to return it. After 3, I was not trying a fourth. If all three had the dispense problem, then quality control was inaffective
customer_reviews.author: Electro

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this, but I love it. I have been using Cuisinart coffee makers for years, but this was a little different because of the option of using the carafe or pod. This one has made the crazy mornings when I am on the run and only need a quick cup of coffee. I highly recommend this Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy3

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime if you like coffee and convince.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is great. One great feature is the single cup maker has its own water reservoir so no need to pour water water in for each cup. Good coffee and great features. Note that the size on description is wrong. It has a smaller footprint. I’ve had this 3-4 months and just love it. I read all reviews before buying and had no problems or complaints. Some one commented they had trouble pouring the water in. I rest the lip of the caraf on the edge of coffee maker and pour water in. Product is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Shordan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Liked the concept. We had our 1st coffee pot for about 3-4 months when kcups began exploding while brewing. Called manufacturer and they suggested I clean it which I had already done (also I only use filtered water). Anyway come to find out they knew there was a problem so they said we’ll replace it for $10. I agreed (wasn’t happy) also had to send old one back when I received new one. This ended up costing me $35. No free shipping or anything. Had the new one for approximately 3 months when we had the same problem. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mousejo

customer_reviews.title: Single serve side leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Was so wishing this would be a nice coffee maker. My husband likes his single serve K cups and I like my pot of decaf. I wanted to consolidate both of our current coffee makers into something smaller so I would have more counter space...BAD choice! The single serve side sprays water like a rain shower! I returned it to Amazon. Cuisinart, was of NO help. I'll keep looking for a decent combo coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: K. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: ehhh
customer_reviews.text: The carafe leaks around the top. And you don't want to pour water into the reservoir with the carafe, we switched to a pitcher with a longer spout because water goes EVERYWHERE, not the easiest to access. The single serve side spits coffee all over the counter. We tried everything to keep it from doing that, but it still does it. The programmable feature is definitely a 5 star. We love that we can just push the button and get up to already made coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it three stars because although it makes great coffee and yes you can have hot coffee within 3 minutes (which was why I bought it), the drawbacks are you can't make coffee the night before where you can just get up and push a button, because if you put water in the reservoir the night before so you can just push a button in the morning, it, of course, makes it right then. The other drawback is it doesn't have the interrupt feature where you can pull the pot and pour coffee while it's still brewing. Other than ​that it makes good coffee but it's not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Spyingdragonflies

customer_reviews.title: Can't fill it without spilling water
customer_reviews.text: I love cuisinart brand items and always buy their brands first. I was so excited to get a new coffee maker that this little faux pas didn't bother me for a while. But now it's very irritating.........when you fill the reservoir with water, you can't get the last bit of water out of the pot and into the reservoir as the lid is in the way. It always spills everywhere. I love the coffeemaker other than that. I set it to start at 5:15am for my husband to have coffee when he gets up. It stays warm for a long time. It's just that one small defect that makes it difficult to fill.
customer_reviews.author: kathy sali

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Station
customer_reviews.text: I study a lot of comments before buying this unit. I have other CuisineArt appliances and have always been happy with their items. This units looks great on our counter and is easy to use. I have had no issues with pods "blowing up" and making a mess. However, now at week three, I have seen water leakage a couple of times on the counter top....not sure where water is coming from, probably through hoses that draw from storage tank. I'll be watching and will want to return if this continues. A little disappointed if I have to find a different unit. Liked the idea of a pot and pod maker in one unit.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Corey

customer_reviews.title: Save $200 and just pour water all over your counter.
customer_reviews.text: Makes good coffee, but also makes a mess every time. At first, I thought it was me. It does dump condensation down the back of the machine when you flip the lid open. I clean that up, make coffee, counter is soaked again. If you make coffee with the single serve side, if you have a tall mug (travel) it's ok. Use a regular coffee cup, goes all over the counter. I bought this because I've had Cuisinart products in the past and they were of superior quality. These days they are of superior price, but inferior quality. Go buy a cheap one, it will work better and only cost $30 for a pot and $60-$100 for a Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Great coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: I had two Kuerigs and so far this cuisinart works better than the other two. I have only used the single serve which works great, I read the reviews and some said they had water flow over their counter, I had that happen once and figured out that I had not seated the water container on the pot correctly, so after that it has not happened again. I am very happy with the cuisinart single serve with the coffee pot maker. I have not cleaned it yet but thinking of doing that soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona

customer_reviews.title: kcup side malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: The kcup side explodes the cups just like the pictures you see in other reviews. It’s the biggest mess and the coffee grounds are everywhere. My first one lasted six months, and the replacement they just sent me last two weeks before it started doing the same thing. They are now sending me a third one. That’s just ridiculous. I am extremely disappointed with this product and do NOT recommend it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Our third Cuisinart K-cup Coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: We had received of first Cuisinart K-cup single serve as a gift. After almost three years it was getting pretty slow at making a cup. Cleaning it wouldn't help. So we bought a Keurig brand, after about four days of issues, we returned it. We looked and found one of our previous model still available and bought it. About three years more it was slowing done and not delivering a full cup. We couldn't find another one of these models. We thought we'd try the Cuisinart SS-15P1 Coffee Center. We really like it. We can make a whole pot of coffee or just a single cup. This is great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Goshorn

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: Loved this...for awhile. It is convienent to have single and pot in one machine, but now I wish I had done it separately. Purchased August 2019. It started leaking water out of the bottom November 2019 - of course, well after the return date. I come home after work to a countertop full of water (even if I put a towel under the machine).I expected a better product from Cuisinart. Now I have to figure out if it can get a return through the seller or manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. We usually use the k cup side but the coffee pot works nicely as well. I gave this a shot despite some negative reviews and am very happy so far. I've had it a couple months now. I do push the k cup down firmly before closing the lid..as per some reviews and find adding water all the way in the back to be not the best but overall am happy with the look, quality and function of this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, a bit pricy but worth the extra spend so far.
customer_reviews.text: After using a Keurig for a few years, it’s nice to have a good brewed cup of coffee again! The K cup side is relegated to hot water and hot chocolate. The brewing side works fine, I’ve had a Cuisinart before and know the drill. The K cup side doesn’t work quite as well as the Keurig did and kind of splashes and makes a little mess. But it functions just fine. This model is a bit pricy for no more than we use the K cup side, but so far it seems to be worth the money. Using it with filtered water, it should last a long time if my past experience with Cuisinart is any guide.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Brayfield

customer_reviews.title: Made Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker was terrible! The first time I used it I thought that it was great since I could use my kcups, I loved that feature and that seemed to work flawlessly. However, when I went to make my first pot water started leaking out everywhere! the bottom, the top, and it even started dripping like it was brewing coffee. I have no idea what was wrong, both my husband and I tried it several times and we could actually watch the water reservoir markings drop as water poured out, this is going back today!
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. I purchased this one to put in our beach rental property. I have one for myself and love the flexibility of a pot or just using a Kcup. My husband prefers coffee from a traditional machine and I like a quick one cup options for midday. We had two separate machines but I hate for my counters to be full of clutter. Perfect solution. The machine we replaced is a cuisinart that we have had for over 15 years. It actually still works so we gave it to one of our kids.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R.

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee fast, slow to get going
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a great coffee maker. There was a bit of confusion in functionality. We learned you cannot brew coffee in the carafe and heat water in the individual side at the same time. Good news is neither one takes long so it's not a bad wait. The greater challenge is there is not an easy way to fill the water for the carafe side. Water has to be poured in a small area at the back of the basket. It is often slow and can make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST COFFEE MAKER EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I am quite the coffee snob. I had another 2-in-1 brand that did not meet up to my standards. The single side took forever to brew and the coffee flavor was seriously troubling. NOT WITH THIS MACHINE! My single cup is made before I can get the water in the carafe. The coffee flavor is also TOP NOTCH. It's design is easy to clean and easy to care for. Makes this coffee snob so proud. =)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley O'Rourke

customer_reviews.title: It's quiet compared to our previous Keurig...
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted this particular coffee maker so we bought it. My single cup container broke in two pieces in less than a month, luckily I had a Keurig container that has lasted over 3-years to replace. Only once has the single serving side malfunctioned sending grounds all over the place. My wife prefers the carafe side as she drinks more than I do. So far so good. It brews quietly, quiter than our previous Kuerig. My wife is happy...
customer_reviews.author: Daddy W

customer_reviews.title: Worthless kitchen equipment for expensive pay
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it. The 12 cup pot always drips when pouring. Access to pour water in the reservoir is questionable. Have to pour water from the side because can't from front because is leaking and dipping on the heater.Looks like design flow. Have to pour brewed coffee in the sink or will have mess on your counter or kitchen cabinets. K cup does not work as advertised. Mine is spilling all over the place. On the bottom of the cup it is the entire coffee grindings. I thought "you" are making filter coffee not Turkish. I wish can return to the manufacturer. This is my third or forth Cuisinart coffee maker and the last one. Just bought Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart - Have your coffee both ways (Single Kcup or a whole Pot)
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisinart SS-15 is an excellent coffee maker. We have only had it about 3 weeks. After researching coffee makers for both single serve and an entire carafe, we chose this model. We have had other Cuisinarts in the past and they have performed well. The reviews on the SS-15 were mostly very positive. The only things I wished it had are : 1. a Metal Carafe so that the burner does not continue to overcook/burn the coffee 2. A larger Kcup serving size greater than 10 oz. 16-20 would be ideal. Overall, I would recommend this appliance.
customer_reviews.author: jkeller2b

customer_reviews.title: Great! But just one little thing...
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is great, and I'm glad I got it. I like a lot of coffee in the morning and one cup at night, so having a big carafe on one side and a single serve on the other is wonderful. My only knock on it is that the single serve splashes quite a bit. I know this is because it leaves enough room for a travel mug (which I appreciate), but it splashes on to the counter a little bit with just a regular mug. Overall, however, that's minor and I love this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler W.

customer_reviews.title: Warm Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker does not livr up to the Cuisinart reputation. On the single side you can only brew a 10 ounce cup which is really about 6 ounces its comes out warm not hot. You can not use the bold flavor option on this side either. On the carafe side the warmer plate shuts off automatically if you forget to turn unit off but it stays on for 4 hours. Thats a lot of electric use. Here also the coffee is also just warn. It is hotter then the single side but to me still not hot enough. I am returning my unit. Dont get me wrong I love Cuisinart products just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: After 6 mo. it messes up
customer_reviews.text: The 12 cup coffee side brews great if you always remember to snap the plastic filter holder into place each time you brew and don't just set it in there. After 6 months of brewing through the single serve side, it started only brewing 2 oz on every setting. I worked with customer service on troubleshooting, I descaled it twice and they finally issued a replacement one month ago. Now the replacement is breaking the tops of the kcups and pouring all the grinds into each cup that is brewed. With this being our second machine with 2 different functional issues, I can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Harris trigger

customer_reviews.title: Nice Concept
customer_reviews.text: Base heater for keeping Coffee Urn Heated did not work after a week. Generally within the time frame of expectation for electronic parts to fail if they are defective in some way. The idea for a single serve matched with ability of brewing 12 cups at once and keep the urn heated so that the coffee doesn't cool until the urn is empty within 2 hours is a wonderful thing. Defective Coffee maker was returned and refund was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Onezipcode

customer_reviews.title: The single serve is the weak point here.
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker portion of this unit is tried and true tech with a shiny new face. The single serve however, is a different story. With traditional k cups it can crack the rim of the k cup and cause it to leak everywhere. I use k cups from San Francisco Bay Coffee Company that have a membrane instead of a full plastic container and these work fine. You do need to use either a tall or wide mouth mug because it can splash.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Great multi use coffepot
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can make a whole pot on days I have time to sit and drink coffee and make individual cups on days I don't have time or I just want a quick pick me up cup during the day. So far everything has worked well and held up. The only thing I don't like is the way you have to put water in for the carafe....it is hard to not spill while filling . Other than that I am happy with the coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, but the carafe leaves a bit to be desired in functionality of pouring
customer_reviews.text: This brews an amazing cup of coffee! Both on the individual cup side and the full pot. The thermal carafe does keep the coffee nice and hot for a very long time. The only reason this has a three star review and not a five, is the difficulty in getting the last cup of coffee out of the carafe. It is also difficult to use the carafe as a picture to fill the coffee pot in the first place. Pouring out of the carafe for the last cup just makes a mess. That being said, I would still purchase this again because of the quality of the cup it produces. It does get the water to the ideal brewing temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Scheen

customer_reviews.title: Works to good maybe
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the picture the pod on the right is before brewing, the pod on the left is after brewing. As you can see the pod on the left has rounded corners, and has shrunk. Maybe the water is too hot. Does not effect the taste. As to the exploding Pods. It looks like they put in a fix. The pod brewer first puts out a puff of air, and if pressure is sensed it stops brewing and turns off all the cup size buttons.
customer_reviews.author: B.Will

product_meta.title: Cuisinart SS-15P1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Silver
product_meta.description: Size:12 Cup| Color:SilverThe Cuisinart Coffee center features a fully automatic 12-Cup coffeemaker on one side and a single-serve brewer on the other. Sipping solo or serving a crowd, it's easy to enjoy the gourmet taste you expect from a Cuisinart coffeemaker. And one coffeemaker that does the job of two frees up more space on your counter! .
